page.title: 01 GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This area consists of mainly farm land bisected by the valley of the River Cherwell which runs north-south. To the east is the village of {AYNHO} set on a hill. It is known as the "Apricot Village" because of the apricots which are grown on the cottage walls. It is the southermost village in Northamptonshire. To the west is the small village of {CLIFTON} in Oxfordshire. South of Aynho is the village of {SOULDERN} in Oxfordshire. The area is about 7 miles south of Banbury. The OXFORD CANAL and 2 RAILWAY LINES follow the course of the River Cherwell and the A.41 TRUNK ROAD passes through the village of Aynho while the B.4031 road passes through Aynho and Clifton.
